message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DB

Reasoning: The paper discusses the construction of a large-scale gazetteer for Turkish named-entity recognition and text categorization, which involves natural language processing and machine learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with the intersection of computer science and linguistics. The paper also mentions the use of graph crawler algorithms and semantic knowledge bases, which are relevant to sub-categories such as cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.DB (Databases). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of noise reduction methodologies and the mapping of fine-grained entity types to coarse-grained types, which are relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
